newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE sugar rangebound in late trading.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE sugar rangebound in late trading.

text.p: White sugar futures lacking in fresh fundamental news remained rangebound by London's 1830 GMT close, a condition matched in the New York market.
Trade buying of the benchmark March contract kept the spot value supported but the upside momentum was not sufficient to attempt an assault on the psychological $300 barrier.
"The market is very much locked in a range and I don't see it breaking out of it for the time being," one trader said earlier.
By the close March was down 10 cents at $298.20, while May was down 60 cents at $297.00 Volume totalled 2,264 lots.
Market sources said the trade buying of March could only be viewed as contributing towards the overall physical delivery against March's expiry on February 13.
